All known rocket anomalies resolved. Will spend another day rechecking to be sure. Launch attempt tmrw eve w Wed as backup.
The gas generator is a small rocket engine that powers the turbopump, which produces 7000 horsepower & weighs 160 lbs
Engines are cycling cleanly w ground pneumatics. Replaced gas generator on engine 9 (center) as a precautionary measure.
Abort was caused by oxygen in ground side TEA-TEB. Upper stage on separate internal circuit, so doesn't face same risk.
Rocket engines are healthy, but cleaning turbopump gas generators will take another day. Aiming for Mon eve launch.
@WilliamShatner Will do. Probably at least a few days. Depends on whether we need to pull the turbopumps.
We called manual abort. Better to be paranoid and wrong. Bringing rocket down to borescope engines ...
If launch aborts, we will bring the rocket down for engine inspection, so probably a few days before next attempt
Increasing helium spin start pressure. Probably <50% chance of passing all aborts, but worth a try. Countdown resuming ...
Launch aborted by autosequence due to slower than expected thrust ramp. Seems ok on closer inspection. Cycling countdown.

Recently my friend and partner Rohit Khattar wanted to take over the lease of an upscale but sinking French restaurant in mid-town New York

@TnR4110 BTW... Nice rig!
@TnR4110 thank you for your note, your concern and your interest. Every American should be giving this issue a lot of thought. Good night.
@TnR4110 sorry I don't have any easy answers. I can assure you that this problem has my full attention and good effort each and every day.
@TnR4110 I would suggest we focus on what will work to make universal coverage affordable and steer our health care system to that place.
@TnR4110 the ACA is a rough start.  Much work needs to be done to improve and complete a hastily constructed and poorly launched program.
@TnR4110 I am not satisfied with where we are at all. Nobody is going to "win" in the current structure...including insurance companies.
@TnR4110 we can argue whether or not these additional costs are the right approach, but we can't argue that people w/o insurance is good!
@TnR4110 ...taxes, equalizing rates for most people, fewer benefit options and smaller provider networks to lower costs.
@TnR4110 the result of covering more people is that the burden for that cost falls on the rest of Americans...the cost gets spread via...
@TnR4110 while the ACA increases the number of people who have insurance, it does very little to control the underlying cost of care.
@TnR4110 your question was cut off.  What info r u looking for?

@TnR4110 BTW... Nice rig!
@TnR4110 thank you for your note, your concern and your interest. Every American should be giving this issue a lot of thought. Good night.
@TnR4110 sorry I don't have any easy answers. I can assure you that this problem has my full attention and good effort each and every day.
@TnR4110 I would suggest we focus on what will work to make universal coverage affordable and steer our health care system to that place.
@TnR4110 the ACA is a rough start.  Much work needs to be done to improve and complete a hastily constructed and poorly launched program.
@TnR4110 I am not satisfied with where we are at all. Nobody is going to "win" in the current structure...including insurance companies.
@TnR4110 we can argue whether or not these additional costs are the right approach, but we can't argue that people w/o insurance is good!
@TnR4110 ...taxes, equalizing rates for most people, fewer benefit options and smaller provider networks to lower costs.
@TnR4110 the result of covering more people is that the burden for that cost falls on the rest of Americans...the cost gets spread via...
@TnR4110 while the ACA increases the number of people who have insurance, it does very little to control the underlying cost of care.
@TnR4110 your question was cut off.  What info r u looking for?

@TnR4110 thank you for your note, your concern and your interest. Every American should be giving this issue a lot of thought. Good night.
@TnR4110 sorry I don't have any easy answers. I can assure you that this problem has my full attention and good effort each and every day.
@TnR4110 I would suggest we focus on what will work to make universal coverage affordable and steer our health care system to that place.
@TnR4110 the ACA is a rough start.  Much work needs to be done to improve and complete a hastily constructed and poorly launched program.
@TnR4110 I am not satisfied with where we are at all. Nobody is going to "win" in the current structure...including insurance companies.
@TnR4110 we can argue whether or not these additional costs are the right approach, but we can't argue that people w/o insurance is good!
@TnR4110 ...taxes, equalizing rates for most people, fewer benefit options and smaller provider networks to lower costs.
@TnR4110 the result of covering more people is that the burden for that cost falls on the rest of Americans...the cost gets spread via...
@TnR4110 while the ACA increases the number of people who have insurance, it does very little to control the underlying cost of care.
@TnR4110 your question was cut off.  What info r u looking for?
